title: Surrey sign Derbyshire paceman Mark Footitt
text:
Surrey sign Derbyshire paceman Mark Footitt 15 Oct 2015 14:17:01 
comments 
Surrey have bolstered their fast bowling ranks for next year by signing highly-rated left-armer Mark Footitt from Derbyshire. 
Despite Footitt having a year left to run on his contract, Derbyshire agreed to release the 29-year-old, the joint leading wicket-taker in Division Two of the LV= County Championship this summer having topped the charts on his own a year ago, after agreeing compensation with Surrey. 
Footitt has signed a four-year deal and admitted the lure of playing in Division One with newly-promoted Surrey could be the springboard to fulfil his England ambitions. 
Footitt, who is uncapped at international level but was called up for England's pre-Ashes training camp and named in the fourth Test squad this summer, said: "It is a fantastic opportunity for me to play first division cricket at a Test match ground for a club with a great tradition. 
"Working with another strong coaching set up at Surrey can only help to further my England ambitions which were started during my time at Derbyshire." 
Footitt moved to Derbyshire in 2010 but it was not until last year that he started to make his mark, taking 82 championship wickets at an average of 19.12. 
He followed that up with another 76 scalps during this campaign at 23.63, with new Surrey team-mate Tom Curran matching his haul. 
Surrey director of cricket Alec Stewart said: "We are delighted to have signed a bowler of the quality of Mark as he is a cricketer that has impressed us with his ability and work ethic for a number of years. 
"His talent with both a red and white ball will add so much to our bowling attack and I would hope his move to the Kia Oval will see him achieve his ambitions of playing for England and competing strongly for domestic trophies." 
There were calls for Footitt to join England's tour in the United Arab Emirates in place of the injured Steven Finn, but Chris Jordan was given the nod instead. 
Capable of generating extreme pace, Footitt is widely regarded as one of the best bowlers in county cricket and Derbyshire were upset to see him depart. 
Chief executive Simon Storey said: "We obviously regret that Mark has decided to move on. Having rejected a contract extension on improved terms, Mark and his agent made it clear he was keen to explore options elsewhere and in these situations, it is better for all parties to find a solution professionally."
